net.fec.openrq.decoder

Interface DataDecoder

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ArrayDataDecoder

    public interface DataDecoder
    A RaptorQ decoder for a data object.

    A decoder receives encoding packets produced by a RaptorQ encoder (as specified by RFC 6330), and decodes the original data object (source data). The source data is divided into a fixed number of source blocks, and each source block can be decoded independently.

    A decoder provides methods for parsing/reading encoding packets from various formats. The parsed/read encoding packets must then be forwarded to the right SourceBlockDecoder object, which takes care of decoding a specific source block. These decoder objects are accessed via the method sourceBlock(int).

    The number of source blocks, the length of the source data and other parameters are specified as the FEC parameters. The method fecParameters() provides the associated parameters to the decoder.

    • Method Detail

      • fecParameters

        FECParameters fecParameters()
        Returns the FEC parameters associated to this decoder.
        Returns:
        the FEC parameters associated to this decoder

      • dataLength

        long dataLength()
        Returns the length of the source data in number of bytes. This value is the one returned by this.fecParameters().dataLength().
        Returns:
        the length of the data in number of bytes

      • symbolSize

        int symbolSize()
        Returns the size of a symbol in number of bytes. This value is the one returned by this.fecParameters().symbolSize().
        Returns:
        the size of a symbol in number of bytes

      • numberOfSourceBlocks

        int numberOfSourceBlocks()
        Returns the number of source blocks into which the source data is partitioned. This value is the one returned by this.fecParameters().numberOfSourceBlocks().
        Returns:
        the number of source blocks

      • isDataDecoded

        boolean isDataDecoded()
        Returns true if, and only if, the original data is fully decoded. The original data is considered fully decoded when every source block is fully decoded.
        Returns:
        true if, and only if, the original data is fully decoded

      • sourceBlock

        SourceBlockDecoder sourceBlock(int sbn)
        Returns a decoder object for the source block with the provided source block number.

        Note that the provided source block number must be non-negative and less than the number of source blocks.

        Parameters:
        sbn - A source block number
        Returns:
        a decoder object for a specific source block

      • parsePacket

        Parsed<EncodingPacket> parsePacket(int sbn,
                                 int esi,
                                 byte[] symbols,
                                 boolean copySymbols)
        Parses an encoding packet from the given source block number, encoding symbol identifier of the first symbol, and symbols data.

        The symbols data will be read, in the array, from position 0 inclusive to position symbols.length exclusive.

        The returned container object indicates if the parsing succeeded or failed:

        • If the parsing succeeded, the encoding packet can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.value()
        • If the parsing failed, the container object will be invalid and the reason for the parsing failure can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.failureReason()
        Parameters:
        sbn - The common source block number of all symbols in the packet
        esi - The encoding symbol identifier of the first symbol in the packet
        symbols - An array of bytes containing the symbols data
        copySymbols - If true, a copy of the symbols data will be performed, otherwise the packet will keep a reference to the array
        Returns:
        a container object containing an encoding packet or a parsing failure reason string
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If symbols is null

      • parsePacket

        Parsed<EncodingPacket> parsePacket(int sbn,
                                 int esi,
                                 byte[] symbols,
                                 int off,
                                 int len,
                                 boolean copySymbols)
        Parses an encoding packet from the given source block number, encoding symbol identifier of the first symbol, and symbols data.

        The symbols data will be read, in the array, from position off inclusive to position (off + len) exclusive.

        The returned container object indicates if the parsing succeeded or failed:

        • If the parsing succeeded, the encoding packet can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.value()
        • If the parsing failed, the container object will be invalid and the reason for the parsing failure can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.failureReason()
        Parameters:
        sbn - The common source block number of all symbols in the packet
        esi - The encoding symbol identifier of the first symbol in the packet
        symbols - An array of bytes containing the symbols data
        off - The starting index in the array (must be non-negative)
        len - The length of the symbols data (must be non-negative and no larger than symbols.length - off)
        copySymbols - If true, a copy of the symbols data will be performed, otherwise the packet will keep a reference to the array
        Returns:
        a container object containing an encoding packet or a parsing failure reason string
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the pre-conditions on the array offset and length do not hold
        NullPointerException - If symbols is null

      • parsePacket

        Parsed<EncodingPacket> parsePacket(int sbn,
                                 int esi,
                                 ByteBuffer symbols,
                                 boolean copySymbols)
        Parses an encoding packet from the given source block number, encoding symbol identifier of the first symbol, and symbols data.

        The symbols data will be read, in the buffer, from the current position inclusive to the current limit exclusive. If the parsing succeeds, the position of the buffer will be advanced to the limit.

        The returned container object indicates if the parsing succeeded or failed:

        • If the parsing succeeded, the encoding packet can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.value()
        • If the parsing failed, the container object will be invalid and the reason for the parsing failure can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.failureReason()
        Parameters:
        sbn - The common source block number of all symbols in the packet
        esi - The encoding symbol identifier of the first symbol in the packet
        symbols - A buffer containing the symbols data
        copySymbols - If true, a copy of the symbols data will be performed, otherwise the packet will keep a duplicate of the buffer
        Returns:
        a container object containing an encoding packet or a parsing failure reason string
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If symbols is null

      • parsePacket

        Parsed<EncodingPacket> parsePacket(SerializablePacket ser,
                                 boolean copySymbols)
        Parses an encoding packet from the given serializable packet.

        The returned container object indicates if the parsing succeeded or failed:

        • If the parsing succeeded, the encoding packet can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.value()
        • If the parsing failed, the container object will be invalid and the reason for the parsing failure can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.failureReason()
        Parameters:
        ser - A serializable packet
        copySymbols - If true, a copy of the symbols data will be performed, otherwise the packet will keep a reference to the array inside the serializable packet
        Returns:
        a container object containing an encoding packet or a parsing failure reason string
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If ser is null

      • parsePacket

        Parsed<EncodingPacket> parsePacket(byte[] array,
                                 boolean copySymbols)
        Parses an encoding packet from the given array. The format of the packet in the array must follow the format specified by EncodingPacket.asArray().

        The encoding packet will be read, in the array, from position 0 inclusive to position array.length exclusive.

        The returned container object indicates if the parsing succeeded or failed:

        • If the parsing succeeded, the encoding packet can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.value()
        • If the parsing failed, the container object will be invalid and the reason for the parsing failure can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.failureReason()
        Parameters:
        array - An array containing an encoding packet
        copySymbols - If true, a copy of the symbols data will be performed, otherwise the packet will keep a reference to the array
        Returns:
        a container object containing an encoding packet or a parsing failure reason string
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If array is null

      • parsePacket

        Parsed<EncodingPacket> parsePacket(byte[] array,
                                 int off,
                                 int len,
                                 boolean copySymbols)
        Parses an encoding packet from the given array. The format of the packet in the array must follow the format specified by EncodingPacket.asArray().

        The encoding packet will be read, in the array, from position off inclusive to position (off + len) exclusive.

        The returned container object indicates if the parsing succeeded or failed:

        • If the parsing succeeded, the encoding packet can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.value()
        • If the parsing failed, the container object will be invalid and the reason for the parsing failure can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.failureReason()
        Parameters:
        array - An array containing an encoding packet
        off - The starting index in the array (must be non-negative)
        len - The length of the encoding packet (must be non-negative and no larger than array.length - off)
        copySymbols - If true, a copy of the symbols data will be performed, otherwise the packet will keep a reference to the array
        Returns:
        a container object containing an encoding packet or a parsing failure reason string
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the pre-conditions on the array offset and length do not hold
        NullPointerException - If array is null

      • parsePacket

        Parsed<EncodingPacket> parsePacket(ByteBuffer buffer,
                                 boolean copySymbols)
        Parses an encoding packet from the given buffer. The format of the packet in the array must follow the format specified by EncodingPacket.asBuffer().

        The encoding packet will be read, in the buffer, from the current position inclusive to the current limit exclusive. If the parsing succeeds, the position of the buffer will be advanced to the limit.

        The returned container object indicates if the parsing succeeded or failed:

        • If the parsing succeeded, the encoding packet can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.value()
        • If the parsing failed, the container object will be invalid and the reason for the parsing failure can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.failureReason()
        Parameters:
        buffer - A buffer containing an encoding packet
        copySymbols - If true, a copy of the symbols data will be performed, otherwise the packet will keep a duplicate of the buffer
        Returns:
        a container object containing an encoding packet or a parsing failure reason string
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If buffer is null

      • readPacketFrom

        Parsed<EncodingPacket> readPacketFrom(DataInput in)
                                      throws IOException
        Reads and parses an encoding packet from a DataInput object. The format of the packet data must follow the format specified by EncodingPacket.writeTo(java.io.DataOutput).

        Examples of DataInput objects are DataInputStream and ObjectInputStream.

        The returned container object indicates if the parsing succeeded or failed:

        • If the parsing succeeded, the encoding packet can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.value()
        • If the parsing failed, the container object will be invalid and the reason for the parsing failure can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.failureReason()
        Parameters:
        in - A DataInput object from which an encoding packet is read
        Returns:
        a container object containing an encoding packet or a parsing failure reason string
        Throws:
        IOException - If an IO error occurs while reading from the DataInput object
        NullPointerException - If in is null

      • readPacketFrom

        Parsed<EncodingPacket> readPacketFrom(ReadableByteChannel ch)
                                      throws IOException
        Reads and parses an encoding packet from a ReadableByteChannel object. The format of the packet data must follow the format specified by EncodingPacket.writeTo(java.nio.channels.WritableByteChannel).

        Examples of ReadableByteChannel objects are SocketChannel and FileChannel.

        The returned container object indicates if the parsing succeeded or failed:

        • If the parsing succeeded, the encoding packet can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.value()
        • If the parsing failed, the container object will be invalid and the reason for the parsing failure can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.failureReason()
        Parameters:
        ch - A ReadableByteChannel object from which an encoding packet is read
        Returns:
        a container object containing an encoding packet or a parsing failure reason string
        Throws:
        IOException - If an IO error occurs while reading from the ReadableByteChannel object
        NullPointerException - If ch is null
